How to demo: # Open up a Multitrans package in Studio # Go to Project Settings-> -> All Languages-> *TM* and observe that Multitrans TM is already added # Go to Editor view and observe that results come from Multitrans TM   h2. Integration only sends 2-letter language codes; this results in a false error message in Studio, when the LC termbase has been created with a sub-language (aka, has the exact, 5-letter, language code). Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create a termbase in Language Cloud; when specifying languages, check the "show sub-languages" option and use some specific sub-languages (example: 'en-us' and 'en-uk', but not the generic 'en') 2. Create a project in Trados Studio, with the same languages; use the termbase. 3. Open a document; check 'Termbase Viewer'. for the sake of example, let's say the doc has 'en-us' as source language. 3a. EXPECTED: 'Termbase Viewer' opens the termbase, on 'en-us'. 3b. ACTUAL: 'Termbase Viewer' fails to match 'en-us' from project with 'en-us' from termbase, and shows an error message. Reference INC000000123316 Customer SAP Add option to handle leading and trailing white spaces when pasting just like MS Office applications do. In customers words: _In MS Office applications, when a user cuts text and pastes the text somewhere else, the application automatically adjusts the leading and trailing white spaces. When the text is pasted after a word, a leading white space is added if not existing in the clipboard. Furthermore, in case the text is pasted before a punctuation mark, trailing white spaces in the clipboard are removed so that there is no white space between the last word and the punctuation a Trados user I want to switch between horizontal and vertical layouts in the universal editor so that arabic characters are displayed properly h2. Conditions of Acceptance: 1. Vertical/Horizontal actions are displayed in the Layout ribbon group of the View ribbon (only) when online editor is active 2. Clicking on any of the actions switches the layout of the displayed document in the online editor to the corresponding display: 2.1 traditional display in the case of the vertical layout - two columns featuring source on the left and target translation on the right 2.2 single column for horizontal, with groups of two rows, top one being source and bottom one - target h2. How to demo: 1. Open Trados, open a file in a project and select online editor in the editor selection dialog box  2. Check that the view ribbon has the Layout ribbon group with the Vertical and Horizontal actions 3. By default, the vertical layout will be used - click on the Horizontal action button and check that the layout changes accordingly 4. Go to Home > Find Observe: "Find" is grayed out 7. Go to File > Save Target As Observe: "Save Target As" is grayed out. 8. Type anything in the target segment. 9. Press [Ctrl] + [Z] Observe: Nothing happens; "Undo" in the Quick Access bar is grayed out 10. Close document. 11. Re-open document (steps 10-11 may or may not be necessary to make further issue reproducible). 12. Select a word in the source segment. 13. Click Home > Concordance Search. Observe: Concordance Search window displays "No open translation memory". Expected: Functions "Save Target As", "Undo", "Find" and "Concordance Search" should be available since they do not use termbases. Note: - If another document is also open in the editor view, the functions "Save Target As" and "Undo" work as expected. part of the enhancements of Japanese / Chinese language support, I would like to ask for the following enhancement. This has been a long term issue in Studio for the Japanese audience, but the current design to apply Arial Unicode MS font against Japanese text displayed on Translation Results / Edit Translation Units windows may need to be revised for the following reason. This font is not the most suitable type for displaying Japanese text at least (we need ask for input about Chinese and Korean text from the native language users). It is true that this font is recommended for Unicode characters in Windows as a safe option to prevent the character corruption. However, when applied as is, the characters appear rather unprofessional as the shape, layout and strokes of the most characters appear very awkward and misaligned. There seems to be several discussion threads / blogs by Japanese Windows users commenting on this font (not specific to Studio application). Currently, there are 2 viable solutions proposed: *1)* adapt the font fall back implemented on Fragment Matches window (currently, MS Gothic UI is specified for Japanese) *2)* use the method of ClearType antialiasing against this old font (Atial Unicode MS) may improve this out-of-date look: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/dd183433(v=vs.85).aspx NOTE: While the solution *1)* may be more favoured, [~aerdei] has pointed out that it may require extensive modifications against the legacy code, which involves changing the whole logic of the Editor. Once the decision is finalise against this, we can seek the advice on the most ideal font for Chinese characters","customfield_10011":null,"customfield_14733":null,"customfield_10013":null,"customfield_10014":null,"customfield_14731":null,"timetracking":{},"attachment":[],"flagged":false,"summary":"[Enhancement] Adapt the font used on Translation Results / Edit Translation Units windows to the type that is suitable for Japanese (and possibly Chinese and Korean) characters","customfield_15132":null,"customfield_13230":null,"customfield_15130":null,"customfield_15131":null,"customfield_13231":null,"customfield_10120":null,"customfield_12541":null,"customfield_13630":null,"customfield_15530":null,"customfield_10121":null,"customfield_15531":null,"customfield_15932":null,"customfield_15933":null,"customfield_15931":null,"comment":{"comments":[],"maxResults":0,"total":0,"startAt":0}}},{"expand":"operations,versionedRepresentations,editmeta,changelog,renderedFields","id":"350446","self":"https://jira.sdl.com/rest/agile/1.0/issue/350446","key":"LG-10746","fields":{"customfield_10070":null,"customfield_12130":null,"customfield_14031":null,"fixVersions":[],"customfield_14832":null,"resolution":null,"customfield_14830":null,"customfield_13856":null,"customfield_13855":null,"customfield_13858":null,"lastViewed":null,"customfield_15231":null,"customfield_15232":null,"customfield_11030":null,"customfield_15230":null,"customfield_15631":null,"customfield_13330":null,"customfield_15632":null,"customfield_13333":null,"customfield_13850":null,"customfield_15233":null,"customfield_13332":null,"customfield_15630":null,"priority":{"self":"https://jira.sdl.com/rest/api/2/priority/10","iconUrl":"https://jira.sdl.com/images/icons/priorities/major.svg","name":"P3. a translator, I would like to switch between documents that are open in the editor quickly; especially when they are open in different context (e.g. one document is open for translation and the other for revision).    Currently this process of switching between documents (_open in different context_) in the editor can take a substantial amount of time to complete, sometimes 10 or more seconds depending on the size of the documents and machine configuration.   It is also noticeable that there is a lot of activity going on in the background during this process as the application area is flickering as the view parts are being removed and loaded, which resembles very sluggish behavior.   The ribbon area is also accessible during this process at certain points which might pose problems if commands are being executed before the documents are fully loaded.   * Investigate and Identify areas related to this process and optimize. * hide view parts that are being removed and loaded while the process is executing. * Include a progress bar (continuous) while this process is executing and prevent access to the ribbon selection focus from the combobox dropdown list should be added to the selected items container.  The only exception to this, is if the language item was already selected, then hitting the Return key would remove it. Additionally, I would expect the combobox dropdown list to close automatically after hitting the Return key and any filter criteria removed automatically.   * Return key Add the language item that has selection focus, close combobox dropdown list and remove any filter criteria automatically. * Space key or Left mouse click Add the language item that has selection focus.  Don’t close combobox dropdown list * SHIFT + Up/Down arrow key Add the language item that has selection focus;
